comments:
This problem is reported against I-build: wtp-I200511291312

Our primary web project encounters major publishing errors. This is a regression that did not exist in the final builds before M9 was declared. The error is reported to the eclispe error log as follows: 

Publishing failed.

The message includes a sub-message for every utility project that looks like this (the actual name of the jar was modified in the bug report):

Error 2005-11-29 15:10:33.70 Error creating zip file xx.yy.zz.jar: duplicate entry: META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
java.util.zip.ZipException: duplicate entry: META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
	at java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream.putNextEntry(ZipOutputStream.java:186)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.core.PublishUtil.addZipEntries(PublishUtil.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.core.PublishUtil.addZipEntries(PublishUtil.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.core.PublishUtil.createZipFile(PublishUtil.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.PublishOperation2.publishJar(PublishOperation2.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.PublishOperation2.execute(PublishOperation2.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.performTasks(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:789)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publish(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:576)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:740)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:729)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:145)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

I can't find a reason for a possible duplication. As background this is a dynamic web project that experienced migration problems but that bug has been fixed (bug 116967). Just to be sure I recreated the project from scratch and encountered the same problem. I then created a trivial web project with a dependent project containing a single trivial class. Publishing still failed.

I went further and started with a new workspace and the problem still ocurred.
Thankfully, when I moved to build 1.0RC1 the publishing error went away.

This ia part of a mass update, marking fixed blockers older than 6 months as automatically verified (the logic being it must be fixed or we sure would have heard about it!) As always, feel free to re-open if not fixed!

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
